archetype_name: Family Weekend Advanced: South African Braai & Potjie
name: Cape Malay-Style Lamb Potjie with Apricots and Oven-Baked Gem Squash
description: A fragrant leg of lamb potjie simmered over coals with warm spices, tomatoes, and apricots, served alongside buttery oven-baked gem squash.
prep_steps: Cut leg of lamb into large chunks (bone-in pieces if using a whole leg).
Peel and slice onions; peel and crush garlic.
Peel carrots and cut into thick chunks; scrub potatoes and cut into large pieces.
Preheat oven to 200°C for the gem squash.
Halve gem squash and scoop out seeds.
Set up a steady medium bed of coals on the outdoor grill for potjie cooking; place potjie on to preheat.
cook_steps: Heat sunflower oil in the potjie over medium coals.
Season lamb with salt and black pepper; brown in batches until well caramelized, then set aside.
Add onions to the potjie; cook until softened. Stir in garlic, masala spice blend, turmeric powder, and ground cumin; toast 30–60 seconds.
Return lamb to the potjie. Add bay leaves, crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, mango chutney, and beef stock. Stir and bring to a gentle simmer.
Nestle in carrots and potatoes. Cover with the lid and cook gently over steady medium-low coals for 90–120 minutes, checking heat and turning the pot every 15–20 minutes to prevent hotspots.
After 60 minutes, taste and adjust salt and black pepper. In the last 20 minutes, add apricots on top, re-cover, and continue to simmer until lamb is tender and the sauce is glossy.

While the potjie cooks, place gem squash halves cut side up on a tray. Add a knob of butter to each, season with salt and black pepper, and roast at 200°C for 35–45 minutes until tender and lightly caramelized.
Rest the potjie off the heat for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped coriander and serve with the buttery gem squash.
